eventDetails: Would you like to reduce stress? Increase happiness? Enhance your focus? Achieve calmness? We can show you techniques you can do with an immediate benefit that takes just a few minutes. We call it Twin Hearts Meditation with an added bonus of self-healing! Give it a try yourself! Event followed by optional Pranic Healing stress relief treatments (10 mins) Public event open to all 18 yrs + Cost: Suggested 10 donation to charity RSVP - discoverpranichealing@gmail
eventName: Twin Hearts Meditation and Healing Clinic Rialto (monthly event)

groupName: Yoga with Reiki - Karina Rodrigues Connection
eventDetails: ‚ú®My yoga classes are gentle movements with a focus on breathing and bringing a connection with the body differently. The classes will have 90 minutes, so we can enter a little deeper into ourselves on the mat and bring outside our vitality and connection. ‚ú®In each class, we'll embrace a different perspective of ourselves and bring it to life. My classes are designed to give you the tools to feel self-empowered and align to the feelings of peace, positivity, and self-empowerment, to listen to your body, to respect your body, and to embody different feelings that you have. ‚ú®What my classes will bring to you? Connection, healing, happiness, positivity, and well-being, removing feelings of anger, stress, fear, negativity, and frustration so you open space in your life for confidence, self-esteem, self-worth, and self-love, you are important. We'll start with breathing techniques, Reiki, Asanas, mantras, meditation, and then Shavasana and end oracle card to guide you with some message. What to bring: ‚ú®Open heart ‚ú®yoga mat ‚ú® water bottle ‚ú® wear comfortable clothes ‚ú® Notebook if have any insight or ideas The exchange: First-class ‚Ç¨15 4 classes are ‚Ç¨65 Drop in ‚Ç¨18 To Book your class or individual session you must go on this for the payment link. https://app.ubindi.com/Karina.Rodrigues.da.Silva Or pay by REvolut @karinaconnection (but you have to message me so I can know you are making the payment through Revolut) Any questions: https://wa.me/message/WJ777TLLCNDRC1 BENEFITS: Breathing techniques: Improves blood circulation, helps with anger, boosts immunity, helps manage Symptoms of Depression and Anxiety, reduces tension to Help With Headaches, and calms our emotions. Reiki: Increases energy, Promotes relaxation, focus, and clarity of mind, Enhances self-confidence, Improves grieving, accelerates the healing process after injuries and surgery, and helps to maintain health and well-being. Asanas: Practising yoga helps control an individual‚Äôs mind, body, and soul. It brings together physical and mental disciplines to achieve a peaceful body and mind; it helps manage stress and anxiety and keeps you relaxed. Yoga also helps in increasing flexibility, muscle strength, and body tone. It improves respiration, energy, and vitality. Practicing asanas might seem like just stretching, but it can do much more for your body from the way you feel, look, and move. Yoga guides you to a deep connection with your inner self, body, and the divine. Mantras: Mantra is a Sanskrit term, with ‚Äúman‚Äù meaning ‚Äúmind‚Äù and ‚Äútra‚Äù meaning ‚Äúrelease.‚Äù Think of a mantra ‚Äî a word or phrase you repeat during meditation ‚Äî as a tool to help release your mind. It can make a lot of difference, especially if you have trouble concentrating or getting in the right frame of mind. Meditation: Gaining a new perspective on stressful situations, building skills to manage your stress, increasing self-awareness, focusing on the present, reducing negative emotions, increasing imagination and creativity, and increasing patience and tolerance. Shavasana: Calms the central nervous system, aiding the digestive and immune systems.Calms the mind and reduces stress and anxiety, helps lower blood pressure, and promotes spiritual awakening and awareness of higher consciousness. ‚ú®Learn how your body is communicating with you all the time, you just need to be willing to start this new healing journey! ‚ú®Be responsible for your BODY, for your LIFE. ‚ú®Learn to listen to yourself, to respect yourself, to forgive and thus become emotionally stronger and no longer feel pain. ‚ú® Come and talk to me, I'm with my heart open to listen to you, let's find the best way to navigate your body's memories, pain, or emotions, walking together to discover the emotional and affective cause, strengthening you're throughout the process of connecting with your true self. ‚ô•Ô∏è Love and gratitude ‚ô•Ô∏è Karina Rodrigues Connection Contact: 089.9692341 Instagram:https://www.instagram.com/p/Cj1Idf3rdgm/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

groupName: Pranic Healing in the Community Wexford
eventDetails: Do you need some time out? To relax and unwind? Join in the Twin Hearts Meditation to help relax you, make your mind calm, feel happier. You might have been interested in doing Meditation because you want to achieve calmness and stillness, or to have a healthier body, purer mind, or maybe to attract positive things, people and increase your good luck. Your intention might even be to become happier, more intelligent, to develop intuition or achieve illumination. It can also be more selfless towards creating a better world for all. Whatever your intention, maybe there is a simple yet effective technique that can take you there. We call it the Meditation on Twin Hearts‚Ä¶ Meditation on Twin Hearts is one of the very advanced spiritual techniques, which was given to selected disciples in the past, and now made public through the valuable efforts of GrandMaster Choa Kok Sui. Its secret relies on activating the human energy centers, the Heart and the Crown without which illumination is not possible. There are many ways of activating the heart and crown chakras, such as Hatha yoga, yogic breathing techniques, chanting mantras and visualization techniques. All of these techniques are effective but not fast enough, while one of the most effective and fastest ways still remains the Meditation on Twin Hearts. BENEFITS OF Meditation on Twins Hearts Reduced stress, anxiety and depression It even disintegrates the unwanted emotions and thought-forms within your chakras and aura. You should know that most of these are not yours. Sharper mind and greater happiness Once the unwanted thought forms and emotions are out of your system, your mind becomes clear and your emotions more refined. Improve your relationships As you bless the entire earth with loving-kindness, you will be filled with love energy. This love brings harmony to your relationships. Improved health Once the divine energy flows through you, it naturally flushes the used up and unwanted energies within your system; so after the meditation, you become a fresher you. Become a divine channel The meditation creates an opportunity for you to become a channel to bless every person, every being on earth with a better life. Increase good luck Once you make yourself available to serve, you create lots of good karma that shows itself in life as good luck.
eventName: Twin Heart Meditation

eventDetails: Join us for an enlightening evening of meditation focused on spiritual healing and self-realization. During this session, you'll embark on a journey to discover the power of holistic health and wellness through the practice of mindfulness and meditation. Our experienced facilitators Michael Bernard and Dr. Francis will guide you through various techniques designed to enhance your mental wellness, ignite spiritual growth, and awaken your true potential. When practiced regularly in the life can have a profound effect on your mental peace, helping to release stress, embrace self-help, and experience a deep connection with your spirituality. This event is suitable for both beginners seeking an introduction to meditation and seasoned practitioners looking to deepen awareness. Don't miss this opportunity to nourish your mind, body, and soul. Join us for a transformative evening that will leave you with a renewed sense of purpose and a path towards self-improvement and self-realization. Love and light, Mata Ji *** Divine Representation and Teacher SHREE MAHARANI JI Facilitators MICHAEL BERNARD COX & DR FRANCIS VALLOOR *** Date/Time: Monday 8th April, 2024. From 7.30 ‚Äì 8.30pm Venue: The Sanctuary, Stanhope Street, Dublin 7. -> Map/Directions: https://maps.app.goo.gl/sw3CzNEha2LKLX4SA Recommended donation: ‚Ç¨10 Contact: via private message or comments section through the Maha Ji Yoga Meditation Meetup page
eventName: Maha Ji Yoga Meditation at The Sanctuary

eventDetails: We're offering Free Trial Classes to anyone interested in joining the Bray Movement School. A school gives us the opportunity to come together as a collective with the dual objective of working on the material and working on ourselves. Through the group we give ourselves a chance to change, transform and most notably, provide a space to awaken and become conscious. A movement practice will provide the platform and broad range of material to contend with. In taking part in a movement school like this I‚Äôll aim to teach material that will help you foster a lifelong movement practice that is independent in its own way and truly unique to you as an individual. We come together as a group to share that unique perspective and elevate our own understanding of movement as part of a community. The school will follow a curriculum based approach in exposing students to what I feel are fundamental practices (listed below) that relate to the field of movement. The teachings will be delivered in an organised, modular and process-based approach in order to present these various systems as a coherent body of knowledge. Website: ronanlewins.ie/movement-school-free-trial
locationInfo: Bray Bowl, Quinsborough Rd, Bray, Wicklow, al
eventName: Free Trial Class - Bray Movement School

eventDetails: You'll meet your local guide at the meeting point a little before 11AM and show your booking. Then we'll commence a fascinating walking tour through the streets, sights, and sounds of Dublin old and new. You'll get an unrivalled insight to the history and culture that has shaped the capital you see today - warts and all, discover the lesser-known, intriguing oddities of our city, and get unique insider tips for the rest of your stay. Sites and topics covered include: Dublin Castle, Christchurch, Viking & Medieval Dublin, Temple Bar, fables, folklore and mythology, Trinity College, Stephen's Green, risings and rebellions, writers & rogues and so, so much more... please remember, places are limited and you must book your spot via: https://www.generationtours.com/dublin See you soon!
eventName: Dublin Free Tour - essentials & oddities

eventDetails: -First 5 minutes: meet and greet and say what you're going to be working on -50 minutes of quiet writing with microphone on mute. Feel free to go off-camera. -Last 5 minutes: come back and discuss as a group how we did Notes: -being on-camera is optional -no critiquing other people's writing, choice of subject, etc. unless specifically asked -have fun :)

eventDetails: Are you looking to develop or enhance your yoga practice and improve your health and well-being? Then you are going to love our Fuego Flow Yoga classes! They are the perfect mix of balance & flexibility, strength & relaxation. Whether you are new to yoga or have been practicing for years, you will find something to suit your level and interest. Expect a dynamic yoga class, a fusion of Hatha, Vinyasa, and Power yoga, offering an energizing and mindful experience that leaves you feeling invigorated. This class focuses on building strength, increasing flexibility, fostering mind-body connection, and cultivating mindfulness while providing a satisfying challenge for your body. Suitable for all levels Theme of this class: Balance and Bone Health This session emphasizes balance poses that enhance bone health and stability. By improving balance, you reduce the risk of falls and fractures. Additionally, these poses engage weight-bearing bones, which can help prevent conditions like osteoporosis. Join us every Tuesday at 7pm at The Carmelite Community Centre, 56 Aungier St, Dublin 2, D02 T258 Yoga instructor for this session: Hanna Book your class directly on our website fuegoflow.ie We offer a variety of pricing options. You can get a single class, a pack of 5/10 or one of the unlimited plans. We are also currently offering all you can eat Zumba & Yoga taster month for 50% off for ‚Ç¨74.5. You can select the "Unlimited 1 month Zumba and Yoga pass" HERE. Use the code TASTER-MONTH during checkout to apply the discount. Please BYOM (Bring Your Own Mat) and be sure to arrive 10 min before the class so you have time to get set up. üßòWe can‚Äôt wait to see you on the mat üßò
eventName: Yoga Class with Fuego Flow (theme: Balance and Bone Health)

eventDetails: Join us for a 9 or 10km run in the Phoenix Park. We commence running at 6:30pm SHARP. The pace will be approximately 5:20 min/km, and you will need to be able to run at this pace unless there are others clicked into the run who can run an alternative pace with you, as the park is now too dark to run alone in. Please wear hi vis and bring a head or chest light. We meet opposite the entrance to the Papal cross carpark, on the small side road. If you have any questions, please let me know, preferably in the comments section as sometimes I don‚Äôt see the messages in the group message section. Thanks Dayle
eventName: Phoenix Park Evening Run

eventDetails: Do you suffer from anorexia, bulimia, obesity, binge eating, or undereating? Are you sick of trying to control your eating? Is your obsession with food taking over your life? Addictive Eaters Anonymous (AEA) is a worldwide Twelve Step fellowship based on Alcoholics Anonymous. AEA members have found recovery from binge eating, anorexia, bulimia, other forms of addictive eating and compulsive exercise. Through working the Twelve Steps of AEA, members find peace of mind and the ability to live a meaningful and productive life. Wherever you are, whatever your problem with food, AEA can help. AEA meeting every Monday evening 7.30pm - 8.30pm in Dublin. There are no fees and everyone is welcome. Please contact us for meeting venue details. Phone: +353 1 554 9725 Email: contact@aeairl.org Website: www.addictiveeatersanonymous.org Please visit our website for weekly online meetings.

eventName: Addictive Eaters Anonymous Dublin

eventDetails: The Playground is back with its weekly drop-in improv workshop! Running on Monday evenings, this is a chance to experience improv among like minded people. No experience necessary and all levels are welcome! Each week we will have a different theme with exercises and activities to allow us improve our improv skills. Whether you are interested in developing the skills for your professional or personal life, or you are someone who currently performs or would like to perform on stage, then there is something for everyone. The longer term objective of The Playground is to create a place for people to develop and create projects and shows, providing regular opportunities for those who wish to perform in shows. Facilitated by two very experienced improvisers, Neil Curran and Quinton O'Reilly, join us for some play! We also have guest teachers join us too * Each drop in session lasts 2 hours and starts at 7pm in the Teacher's Club. * Each drop in costs just ‚Ç¨12. * You can also sign up for membership which costs just ‚Ç¨30 per calendar month and gets you access to all workshops. * No experience necessary and all levels welcome. * Events run on a drop in basis offering flexibility for those who can't commit to doing a course. * Payment can be made on arrival. For more about Neil Curran please visit www.lowerthetone.com Check us out on Instagram here: https://www.instagram.com/improv_playground/
eventName: The Playground: Weekly Improv Drop In Event

eventDetails: Indulge in calming teas and snacks while engaging in lively conversations with other artists. As you mingle, exchange experiences and wisdom, fostering a supportive atmosphere aimed at unleashing boundless creativity. This is an opportunity for you to work on your own art piece as well as being surrounded by like minded artists. While we provide the essentials such as paper and brushes, we encourage you to bring your own art supplies to enhance your creative journey. Embrace the opportunity to personalize your artistic process and delve deeper into your unique expression. Tickets sold HERE to secure your spot or pay at the door Through curated activities and meaningful discussions, you'll delve into the heart of your creative challenges. By sharing insights and strategies with your peers, you'll uncover innovative ways to overcome artistic hurdles. Join us in breaking through the barriers of creative block and nurturing a vibrant community of artists.
eventName: Art Block Unlocked: Break Through Creativity Barriers

eventDetails: -First 5 minutes: meet and greet and say what you're going to be working on -50 minutes of quiet writing with microphone on mute. Feel free to go off-camera. -Last 5 minutes: come back and discuss as a group how we did Notes: -being on-camera is optional -no critiquing other people's writing, choice of subject, etc. unless specifically asked -have fun :)

eventName: Online Meet and Write!

eventDetails: We're offering Free Trial Classes to anyone interested in joining the Bray Movement School. A school gives us the opportunity to come together as a collective with the dual objective of working on the material and working on ourselves. Through the group we give ourselves a chance to change, transform and most notably, provide a space to awaken and become conscious. A movement practice will provide the platform and broad range of material to contend with. In taking part in a movement school like this I‚Äôll aim to teach material that will help you foster a lifelong movement practice that is independent in its own way and truly unique to you as an individual. We come together as a group to share that unique perspective and elevate our own understanding of movement as part of a community. The school will follow a curriculum based approach in exposing students to what I feel are fundamental practices (listed below) that relate to the field of movement. The teachings will be delivered in an organised, modular and process-based approach in order to present these various systems as a coherent body of knowledge. Website: ronanlewins.ie/movement-school-free-trial
locationInfo: Bray Bowl, Quinsborough Rd, Bray, Wicklow, al
eventName: Free Trial Class - Bray Movement School

Don't miss The Big Gig in Dublin's heart!

groupName: Irish Social Dancing: Set Dancing and Sean N√≥s
eventDetails: Hello all! My name is Louise O Connor. Im a fiddle player and dancer from County Clare and I love teaching the Irish dances I grew up doing back home. You're very welcome to join us for social dancing in the Backroom of The Cobblestone starting again January 15th at 7.15pm. It is very relaxed and informal and always great fun. The dancers that have come so far have all gotten to know each other which is lovely. They have been locals as well as people coming from different countries. Booking link is here: www.louise.ie/beginners Ill be teaching set dancing which is an traditional Irish social dance. You do not need a partner to attend and all levels of dancers are welcome. We will dance a different set each night. If you are already familiar with the sets you can still enjoy dancing through the sets. We will learn the Plain, Ballyvourney Jig, Kilfenora amongst others. You can of course carry on the night in The Cobblestone Pub after where there is always brilliant live music playing. I will also be organising some live music C√©il√≠ or party events. The next one will be on January 28th in the Grand Social. All the info is here: www.louise.ie/areyadancin We'll have a live band and Irish College style dances instructed in both English and Irish
eventName: Beginners Irish Social Dancing in The Cobblestone Pub: Set Dancing

groupName: Stefano Argentine Tango, Dublin Tango School
eventDetails: Hi Everyone! Hola! Ciao! Every Monday 18.30 class for absolute beginner, 19.30 for advanced and 20.30 for intermediate dancer 21.30 onwards we have social dance / practice. For Beginner or absolute beginner: no partner and no experience needed. Don't be nervous! üôÇ ... Our classes are fun and exciting - and we're very warm and welcoming üòâ ‚Ä¢ Experienced teachers. ‚Ä¢ Attentive, personal tuition. IMPORTANT:- TRAINERS and RUBBER SOLES are NOT suitable for Tango CLASS PRICES with online booking at dublintangoschoo.com https://www.dublintangoschool.com/dublin-tango-school-event-page ‚Ç¨13 with loyalty card (6 classes for 78euro) ‚Ç¨15 1 classes ‚Ç¨20 2 classes in the same day ‚Ç¨25 3 classes in the same day PRIVATE TUITION ALSO AVAILABLE. Join our FB group Facebook:- https://www.facebook.com/mytangoforyou/ NB:- to be sure you are always notified of upcoming events, festivals or any schedule changes check out our Facebook page:- Dublin Tango School (That's where we attract most of our attendees) If you prefer to receive information by email just mail me at TangoDublinSchool@gmail.com See you Monday!! Stefano
locationInfo: Sycamore Building, Sycamore Street, Temple Bar, Dublin

eventDetails: Are you looking to develop or enhance your yoga practice and improve your health and well-being? Then you are going to love our Fuego Flow Yoga classes! They are the perfect mix of balance & flexibility, strength & relaxation. Whether you are new to yoga or have been practicing for years, you will find something to suit your level and interest. Expect a dynamic yoga class, a fusion of Hatha, Vinyasa, and Power yoga, offering an energizing and mindful experience that leaves you feeling invigorated. This class focuses on building strength, increasing flexibility, fostering mind-body connection, and cultivating mindfulness while providing a satisfying challenge for your body. Suitable for all levels Theme of this class: Balance and Bone Health This session emphasizes balance poses that enhance bone health and stability. By improving balance, you reduce the risk of falls and fractures. Additionally, these poses engage weight-bearing bones, which can help prevent conditions like osteoporosis. Join us every Tuesday at 7pm at The Carmelite Community Centre, 56 Aungier St, Dublin 2, D02 T258 Yoga instructor for this session: Hanna Book your class directly on our website fuegoflow.ie We offer a variety of pricing options. You can get a single class, a pack of 5/10 or one of the unlimited plans. We are also currently offering all you can eat Zumba & Yoga taster month for 50% off for ‚Ç¨74.5. You can select the "Unlimited 1 month Zumba and Yoga pass" HERE. Use the code TASTER-MONTH during checkout to apply the discount. Please BYOM (Bring Your Own Mat) and be sure to arrive 10 min before the class so you have time to get set up. üßòWe can‚Äôt wait to see you on the mat üßò
eventName: Yoga Class with Fuego Flow (theme: Balance and Bone Health)

Lots of people bring plenty of games and rules will always be explained so don't worry if you're new to the hobby and you don't have anything to bring along or think you won't know how to play. Check out the comments below where people will say what games they are bringing and express your interest in joining if interested.

eventDetails: If you're an actor, writer, director, cinematographer or are interested in trying your hand at any area of filmmaking, amateur, professional or complete newbie come along to Dublin Film Makers. We're a group of people from all different backgrounds and with different skills who love to come together, share our knowledge and make films. New members are very welcome!

groupName: New and Not So New In Dublin
eventDetails: Hi all! We will be meeting in St Patrick's Park beside St Patrick's Cathedral at 3pm. Dave has kindly agreed to do his great tour for ‚Ç¨5 (instead of ‚Ç¨10). After the tour we will go for drinks in Darkey Kelly's pub on Fishamble Street. Ancient Dublin Tour Dublin Rogues Tour invites you on a tour of Ancient Dublin taking in St Patrick's Cathedral, St Patrick's Park, the Liberties, the Iveagh Trust buildings, Christchurch Cathedral, the first Viking Settlement at Wood Quay, Fishamble Street, The Dubh Linn Gardens and Dublin Castle. The tour will last about 1 hour and 30 minutes starting at St Patrick's Cathedral, note we will not be going into any of the buildings but we will discuss the history of all these great landmarks and buildings.
locationInfo: 19 Fishamble Street, Christchurch Pl, Dublin 8, D
eventName: Ancient Dublin Rogues Tour / Drinks in Darkey Kelly's  after

groupName: Explore the cities of UK and Ireland playing and learning
eventDetails: Have fun alone or make your team and start walking through Dublin's best attractions solving riddles! Learn interesting things about the city and the attractions! Play an app led city game ! Take your companion or meet new teammates and test your co operation skills! Book your game on https://worldcitytrail.com/product/dublin-scavenger-hunt ! Cost: 10 EUR (50%) off, only for this group's members, apply coupon: MTP50 in your cart page! Have fun !
eventName: Dublin scavenger hunt - Explore the city playing and learning!

eventDetails: Details: SPACE: Four participant sewing class, plus the host, held in a comfortable, spacious living room , with double doors beside us, as we work. CLASS CONTENT: Learn to use a sewing machine (maybe bring your own along if you wish to gain confidence in using it) Make a cute cotton tote bag (or your own project) / have some fun / meet like minded new friends and learn a new skill / craft. Progress to make a simple piece of clothing! What‚Äôs available: MATERIALS: I supply large selection of threads / pins / needles and rippers! You may wish to bring your own fabric and extras eg. ribbon, lace etc for your individual item (happy to help you choose/source fabrics) Also up-cycling of an old crisp cotton dress or shirt is encouraged.
eventName: Rathfarnham Sewing Machine Classes MONDAY 7.00  for fun and creativity

eventDetails: You'll meet your local guide at the meeting point a little before 11AM and show your booking. Then we'll commence a fascinating walking tour through the streets, sights, and sounds of Dublin old and new. You'll get an unrivalled insight to the history and culture that has shaped the capital you see today - warts and all, discover the lesser-known, intriguing oddities of our city, and get unique insider tips for the rest of your stay. Sites and topics covered include: Dublin Castle, Christchurch, Viking & Medieval Dublin, Temple Bar, fables, folklore and mythology, Trinity College, Stephen's Green, risings and rebellions, writers & rogues and so, so much more... please remember, places are limited and you must book your spot via: https://www.generationtours.com/dublin See you soon!
eventName: Dublin Free Tour - essentials & oddities
